name: Dorsett Shanghai @ Century Park
detail: The Yue Hotel is good value for money if you are coming with a family. My family of five stayed a total of three nights with three in one room and two in the other. The morning breakfast is a real plus with an excellent selection of food at the buffet. The hotel has easy access to Century Park, nearby Kerry Parkside Mall, (a little overpriced for Shanghai), The metro is directly underneath the hotel, and there is a really great cheap supermarket across the road. Ten minutes by taxi and you are at AP Plaza great for fake brand shopping. The Bund is within easy reach and the airport is about 45 minutes (130 yuan) or thr Maglev station is less than 10 minutes away by taxi or subway. There are some pretty crappy hotels in Shanghai and we made the mistake of staying at one once. The price was not far different but it was in a different league completely. One thing to note is that the wifi is available in the lobby not in the rooms. Lan cables are available in the rooms. Well worth your money, with or without the breakfast. We have no complaints. Speak slow and simply with the staff in English. It works out better.
area: Lujiazui and New Int'l Expo Center Pudong,Shanghai - View on map

name: Paramount Gallery Hotel
detail: This 12-to-20th floor hotel is located in a major posh shopping district of Shanghai and there is a metro station just across the street. The amenities are limited for a five-star rated hotel, but the facilities offered are tasteful and top-notch. Our room had a spectacular view overlooking the magnificent Jing-An Temple and beyond. Shopping and food in the area is more than plentiful. The building also hosts a famous spa just below the hotel. The breakfast offering was smaller than expected but still sufficient for both local and western taste buds. The emphasis is on quality rather than quantity. The only minor complaint was the lack of a bathtub. By the way, service is always pleasant and splendid for Chinese-speakers/ nationalists. It seems that most complaints about bad service in China on Agoda are from non-Chinese speakers. Well, conversely... I almost never see any other country catering to non-English/local languages. Well, you know what they say… “When in Rome… ”
area: Jing'an and SHA Railway Station,Shanghai - View on map

name: City Hotel
detail: This was a great room, large, very clean and well appointed.

detail: The room is clean and it is a comfortable stay.

name: SHANGHAI-DECO Hotel-Free shuttle bus to Pudong Airport and Disneyland
detail: If you will be taking the free shuttle service, exit at T1 Gate 8 on the 1st floor (or i think Gate 27 for those at T2). There will be no signs to where you should wait but just wait right in front of the exit of Gate 8. The shuttle bus of Shanghai Deco is a LIGHT BLUE mini bus that arrives every 20-30 mins, don’t get on the big buses because those are for other hotels/locations. We found it difficult to figure out where to go because no one speaks and understands english when we asked about the shuttle despite showing them the name of the hotel. Another tip: If you will be going around and need to speak to locals, load a translator on bing.com (google does not load in China). This will save you a lot of time from repeating yourself to locals who don’t understand english.
area: Pudong Int'l Airport and New District,Shanghai - View on map

name: Himalayas Hotel Shanghai
detail: We had a great time with the Hotel.

name: Ramada Plaza by Wyndham Shanghai Pudong Airport
detail: Room was lovely, super comfy bed, great shower pressure.
area: Pudong Int'l Airport and New District,Shanghai - View on map

name: Jin Jiang Hotel
detail: We have stayed at many Jin Jiang hotels in China, but this was our first time staying at the flagship hotel in Shanghai. We were very impressed with the quality, cleanliness, and professionalism of the staff. Booking through agoda gave us the opportunity we probably wouldn't have otherwise had to stay at this 5-star hotel because of the great value offered. Interesting to note that many famous people have stayed there previously, including Reagan, Thatcher, and Deng Xiao Ping. It was also very convenient to Metro's line 1 and within walking distance to many stops and restaurants. The staff was always very helpful in calling a taxi for us when necessary, however. The only slight negative was the fact that there are many entrances on the Jin Jiang site which can become a little confusing to new guests and taxi drivers; however, the staff was always available to guide and deliver us where we needed to go. We would definitely stay there again in the future - with agoda's help, of course!
area: Xintiandi and Huaihai Rd,Shanghai - View on map

name: Hyatt On The Bund
detail: Probably one of the best hotel I stayed in Shanghai the most hip and happening among all three Hyatt in the city. Spent my new year eve count down at the Vue bar, very memorable and unforgettable experience, it offer stunning view of Shanghai both Pu dong and Pu xi view, thought the location of the hotel is at Pu xi side. I would recommend all guest to have a drink at the Vue bar to chill out. Being situated at Pu xi, Huang Pu Road the hotel is minutes walk from the Bund and nan jing road where most of the great, shopping, restaurant and bar located at. Very convenient location. As for the facility, Hyatt on the Bund provide better facility than other 5 star hotel in city. warm pool and great gym. I stayed at the club room on the east tower at 27 floor that offer magnificent view, the room is spacious and amenity is nice. I truly enjoy my stay at Hyatt on Bund and will stay here again come May Shanghai Expo.
area: The Bund and North Bund,Shanghai - View on map
